alert.note: Alert for Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 11 at 12:01AM CDT until September 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR WHEELER...GRAY...COLLINGSWORTH AND DONLEY COUNTIES... At 1200 AM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Lefors to 5 miles northeast of Brice, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 1154 PM CDT, automated weather equipment recorded a 58 mph wind gust 2 miles west southwest of Clarendon. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wellington, Clarendon, Shamrock, Wheeler, Mclean, Lefors, Howardwick, Hedley, Dodson, Lutie, Lelia Lake, Lake Mcclellan, Twitty, Lela, Quail, Samnorwood, Kellerville, Dozier, Alanreed, and Greenbelt Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
